instruments.name: Adungu
instruments.description: A bow harp popular among the Alur people, used in storytelling and traditional ceremonies.

instruments.name: Engalabi
instruments.description: A long drum used in Kiganda music, known for its deep resonant sound.

instruments.name: Amadinda
instruments.description: A wooden xylophone played in Buganda, often used in royal gatherings.

instruments.name: Endingidi
instruments.description: A one-stringed fiddle commonly played among the Baganda and Banyankole.

instruments.name: Ensaasi
instruments.description: Shakers made from gourds, filled with seeds or beads, used to add rhythm to Ugandan music.

instruments.name: Entongoli
instruments.description: A lyre instrument played by the Basoga, often accompanying traditional folk songs.

instruments.name: Akogo
instruments.description: A thumb piano used by the Iteso and other Ugandan communities for melodies and harmonies.

dances.name: Bwola Dance
dances.description: A royal dance of the Acholi people performed at important cultural ceremonies.

dances.name: Kadodi Dance
dances.description: A high-energy initiation dance of the Bagisu, often performed during male circumcision ceremonies.

dances.name: Kiganda Dance
dances.description: A popular dance among the Baganda, characterized by intricate footwork and graceful movements.

dances.name: Runyege Dance
dances.description: A courtship dance of the Banyoro and Batooro, performed with ankle bells for rhythmic effect.

dances.name: Ekizino Dance
dances.description: A cultural dance from Bakiga, involving synchronized foot movements and energetic jumps.

dances.name: Ekitaguriro Dance
dances.description: A traditional dance of the Banyankole, often performed during cattle-keeping ceremonies.

dances.name: Ndere Troupe Dance
dances.description: A fusion of different Ugandan traditional dances, performed by the famous Ndere Troupe.

dances.name: Ankole Dance
dances.description: A cultural dance of the Banyankole, showcasing graceful movements inspired by cattle herding traditions.
